boardgame.description: User review:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The six Investor cards are shuffled and one is dealt face up to each player. Any Investor cards not dealt to the players are set aside for now. The Influence Card deck is shuffled and each player is dealt five cards face down. The player whose Investor is first in alphabetical order goes first. The player to the starting player_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s right places the Dollar marker on any space on the game board._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each space on the game board represents a potential deal which Investors have to approve the deal and the number of dividends to be paid to those investors._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;On one_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s turn, a player can open negotiations on the deal where the Dollar marker rests or roll the six-sided die. If the player rolls the die, the Dollar marker is advanced clockwise around the game board counting the available deals as spaces. Once the Dollar marker rests, the player may try to negotiate that deal or draw three Influence cards. If by drawing cards, the player_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s hand exceeds twelve the player chooses which cards to discard to the limit._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Should a player choose to make the deal, the player negotiates with the player or players representing the Investors how to divide the money at stake. The amount is number of dividends written on the space multiplied by value of the shares written on the deal tile. Any or all of the players may use their Influence cards to affect the outcome of the deal:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Clan cards may act in place of Investors whether the Investors are in play or not._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Travel cards put Investors out of play for the negotiations. Some are specific for a given Investor; some are wild to be played on any Investor._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Recruitment cards can only be played in sets of three to steal another player_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s Investor and make it your own._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Boss cards give the player control of the negotiations._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Stop cards immediately stop the effects of Travel, Recruitment, and Boss Influence cards._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The players are paid from the bank when a deal has been struck. The game board space is covered with the Deal tile (effectively closing the space from further game play), the Dollar marker is moved to the next open space, and play continues with next player._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Once nine deals have been made, a die is rolled after each subsequent deal to determine whether the game ends (with the odds increasing each time). Victory goes to whoever has the biggest bankroll!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: #10: Everyone is Wrong and We are Right

ORIGINAL PRINT by Schmidt ! Perfect condition, unplayed FREE SHIPPING TO EUROPE AND NORTH AMERICA !!! Any boardgames order from this list starting from: $250 and above (EU zone) $360 and above (rest of Europe) $500 and above (USA and Canada) will ship FOR FREE, including sturdy package and tracking number !!! Any other destination country will also get very special shipping prices, almost free, ask for details !!

Condition Notes: Still in shrinkwrap. (I also have a second copy with a slightly dinged up box that I would sell for $2 less). Shipping Notes: You are welcome to come to Community Game Night (see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/127654) and pick up your game in person and pay $0 for shipping. Yes, we will gladly combine orders to reduce your per item shipping costs. (To see other items to add to your order see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekstore.php3?action=viewuser_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;username=RoamDog). In fact, if you buy enough the shipping costs will be FREE. Please provide a contact phone number--this is ONLY in case there are shipping issues--I am NOT planning to call you. Also, if you would like tracking information, also provide a direct/external (non-BGG) email address. Finally, if at all possible, please provide a business (rather than a residential) address (this will expedite delivery) and let us know that the address you are providing is a business address. Payment Notes: US buyers: USPS money order is preferred. Western Union transfer is also acceptable. However, I can also take a Paypal payment if you have _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 50 positive references on BGG. But the only type of Paypal payment that I can accept is one funded by a Paypal balance or an immediate bank transfer. I cannot take a Paypal payment that is funded via credit card. (Also see the note at the bottom regarding Paypal payments impact on the discounted price). If the receiver elects to not pay extra for insurance (totally up to the receiver) then the receiver agrees to assume responsibility for lost or damaged packages. Non-US buyers: Western Union wire transfer (see www.westernunion.com) is the only acceptable form of payment. Non-US buyers--Please also note that the shipping charge will be outrageously high. Probably high enough that it does not make sense to purchase this item from me. I have no control over this. Insurance will also be REQUIRED (at receiver_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s expense) for shipments to non-US addresses. Receivers outside the US must also agree to assume ALL responsibility for taxes, tariffs, customs duties, etc. If these terms are not acceptable, please do not order from me. **Note that the offered price is the discounted price for a cash (cash, money order, western union) payment. The non-discounted price (i.e. paypal payments) will be 3.0% plus 35 cents higher.
Item reserved for raid1280.

Face 2 Face Games (F2F 001) I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m the Boss is a game of deal making and negotiation, where you are an investor just trying to make a deal. Through intelligent negotiations, temporary alliances, and cutthroat bargaining you will rake in millions. But watch out for the other investors at your bargaining table who meddle in your affairs and try to take over your deals. As the boss, you stand to gain the most, but you can find yourself quickly cut out of a deal. In the end, the winner is the investor with the most money.

Face 2 Face Games (F2F 001) I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m the Boss is a game of deal making and negotiation, where you are an investor just trying to make a deal. Comments: Classic from Sid Sackson To see other titles that I have for sale (and perhaps mitigate shipping costs) enter the following into your browser: http://boardgamegeek.com/geekstore.php3?action=quicksalelist_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;username=roamdog Condition Notes: Smoke-free home. Played once and in excellent shape, but the box top has one blown corner. I also have a copy that is still in shrink for a bit more. Shipping Notes: You are welcome to come to Community Game Night (see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/127654) and pick up your game in person and pay $0.00 for shipping. Otherwise--Yes, I will gladly combine orders to reduce your per item shipping costs. (To see other items to add to your order see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekstore.php3?action=viewuser_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;username=RoamDog). Please provide a contact phone number--this is ONLY in case there are shipping issues--I am NOT planning to call you. Also, if you would like tracking information, also provide a direct/external (non-BGG) email address. Finally, if at all possible, please provide a business (rather than a residential) address and let me know that the address you are providing is a business address (this will expedite delivery). Payment Notes: US buyers: Please send a USPS money order from you (safest possible $$ transfer) to me. Alternatively, Please send an online Amazon gift card to me (see https://www.amazon.com/gp/gc/order-email?ie=UTF8_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ref_=gc_lp_4ways_email_white -- fast -- easy -- no extra charge to you or me). Alternatively, You can send a Western Union transfer to me. If the receiver (you) elects to NOT pay extra for insurance (decision is totally up to the receiver) then the receiver agrees to assume responsibility for lost or damaged packages (I cannot remember ever having a problem, but the risk is there). Non-US buyers: Please send an online Amazon gift card (see https://www.amazon.com/gp/gc/order-email?ie=UTF8_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ref_=gc_lp_4ways_email_white -- fast -- easy -- no extra charge to you or me) to me. Must be in US dollars and you pay any fees. Alternatively, You can send a Western Union transfer to me. Must be in US dollars and you pay any fees. Non-US buyers--Please also note that given the recent rate increase by the USPS, the shipping charge will be outrageously high. Probably high enough that it does not make sense to purchase this item from me unless you literally cannot find it anywhere else. I have no control over these shipping charges. Insurance will also be REQUIRED (at receiver_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s expense) for shipments to non-US addresses. Receivers outside the US must also agree to assume ALL responsibility for taxes, tariffs, customs duties, etc. If these terms are not acceptable, please do not order from me. **Note that the offered price is the discounted price for a cash (cash, money order, Amazon Gift Card, western union) payment. I do not really accept Paypal payments any more, but if you absolutely insist that Paypal is the only way that you can get the money to me, then please plan to pay an extra $0.50 plus and additional 5% of the total. To see other titles that I have for sale (and perhaps mitigate shipping costs) enter the following into your browser: http://boardgamegeek.com/geekstore.php3?action=quicksalelist_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;username=roamdog

Gryphon Games (GRY101067N) I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m the Boss is a game of deal making and negotiation, where you are an investor just trying to make a deal. Through intelligent negotiations, temporary alliances, and cutthroat bargaining you will rake in millions. But watch out for the other investors at your bargaining table who meddle in your affairs and try to take over your deals. As the boss, you stand to gain the most, but you can find yourself quickly cut out of a deal. In the end, the winner is the investor with the most money. Sid Sackson is famous in the gaming world for creating a myriad of brilliant game designs and _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m the Boss_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; is certainly one of his very best. This popular classic was first published in German as _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;Kohle, Kies _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Knete_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; back in 1994 and was nominated for game of the year (Spiel des Jahres Nominee 1994). _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m the Boss_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; has been out of print for nearly a decade but is now available for the first time in English. This English reprinting includes all new art, rule translations for German, Spanish and French languages and additional _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;house rules_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; created by loyal Sackson fans over the years. If you enjoy a free wheeling game full of turbulent negotiations and fast-paced deals, this game is for you.
